intro: Cullen pogonocarpum, commonly known as the horned cullen, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, elongated calyx that resembles a horn, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Cullen pogonocarpum is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
